members.member:
Copied from Pcap.Net @ 20091117
Code constants for well-defined ethernet protocols.
EtherType is a two-octet field in an Ethernet frame, as defined by the Ethernet II framing networking standard. It is used to indicate which protocol is encapsulated in the payload.
Also contains entries taken from linux/if_ether.h and tcpdump/ethertype.h

member.name: T:PacketDotNet.Ieee80211.BeaconFrame
member.summary:
Format of an 802.11 management beacon frame.
Beacon frames are used to annouce the existance of a wireless network. If an access point has been configured to not broadcast its SSID then it may not transmit beacon frames.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.Ieee80211.BeaconFrame.Timestamp
member.summary:
The number of microseconds the networks master timekeeper has been active.
Used for synchronisation between stations in an IBSS. When it reaches the maximum value the timestamp will wrap (not very likely).

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.Ieee80211.BeaconFrame.BeaconInterval
member.summary:
The number of "time units" between beacon frames.
A time unit is 1,024 microseconds. This interval is usually set to 100 which equates to approximately 100 milliseconds or 0.1 seconds.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.Ieee80211.BeaconFrame.CapabilityInformationBytes
member.summary: Frame control bytes are the first two bytes of the frame

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.Ieee80211.BeaconFrame.CapabilityInformation
member.summary: Defines the capabilities of the network.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.Ieee80211.BeaconFrame.FrameSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the frame.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.Ieee80211.BeaconFrame.InformationElements
member.summary:
The information elements included in the frame
Most (but not all) beacons frames will contain an Information element that contains the SSID.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.NetworkLSA.AttachedRouters
member.summary: The Router IDs of each of the routers attached to the network. Actually, only those routers that are fully adjacent to the Designated Router are listed. The Designated Router includes itself in this list. The number of routers included can be deduced from the LSA header's length field.

member.name: T:PacketDotNet.SummaryLSA
member.summary: Summary-LSAs are the Type 3 and 4 LSAs. These LSAs are originated by area border routers. Summary-LSAs describe inter-area destinations. Type 3 summary-LSAs are used when the destination is an IP network, Type 4 - an AS boundary router.

member.summary: The type of the lsa.

member.summary: Default constructor

member.summary: Constructs a packet from bytes and offset and length

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.SummaryLSA.NetworkMask
member.summary: For Type 3 summary-LSAs, this indicates the destination network's IP address mask. This field is not meaningful and must be zero for Type 4 summary-LSAs.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.SummaryLSA.Metric
member.summary: The cost of this route. Expressed in the same units as the interface costs in the router-LSAs.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.SummaryLSA.TOSMetrics
member.summary: Additional TOS-specific information for backward compatibility with previous versions of the OSPF specification

member.name: T:PacketDotNet.IPv4Packet.TypesOfService_Fields
member.summary:
Type of service code constants for IP. Type of service describes how a packet should be handled.
TOS is an 8-bit record in an IP header which contains a 3-bit precendence field, 4 TOS bit fields and a 0 bit.
The following constants are bit masks which can be logically and'ed with the 8-bit IP TOS field to determine what type of service is set.
Taken from TCP/IP Illustrated V1 by Richard Stevens, p34.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.IPv4Packet.ipVersion
member.value: Version number of the IP protocol being used

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.IPv4Packet.Version
member.summary: Get the IP version code.

member.name: P:PacketDotNet.IPv4Packet.HeaderLength
member.summary: The IP header length field. At most, this can be a four-bit value. The high order bits beyond the fourth bit will be ignored.

member.name: T:PacketDotNet.LinkLayers
member.summary:
Link-layer type codes.
Taken from libpcap/bpf/net/bpf.h and pcap/net/bpf.h.
The link-layer type is used to determine what data-structure the IP protocol bits will be encapsulated inside of.
On a 10/100mbps network, packets are encapsulated inside of ethernet. 14-byte ethernet headers which contain MAC addresses and an ethernet type field.
On ethernet over ppp, the link-layer type is raw, and packets are not encapsulated in any ethernet header.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.PPPoECode.ActiveDiscoveryOffer
member.summary: Active Discovery Offer (PADO) packet

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.PPPoECode.ActiveDiscoveryInitiation
member.summary:
From RFC2516: The Host sends the PADI packet with the DESTINATION_ADDR set to the broadcast address. The CODE field is set to 0x09 and the SESSION_ID MUST be set to 0x0000.
The PADI packet MUST contain exactly one TAG of TAG_TYPE Service- Name, indicating the service the Host is requesting, and any number of other TAG types. An entire PADI packet (including the PPPoE header) MUST NOT exceed 1484 octets so as to leave sufficient room for a relay agent to add a Relay-Session-Id TAG.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.PPPoECode.ActiveDiscoveryTerminate
member.summary: Indicate that the PPPoe session specified by the SessionId field of the PPPoe packet has been terminated

member.summary: Signifies the end of a LLDPU
member.description: The End Of LLDPDU TLV is a 2-octet, all-zero TLV that is used to mark the end of the TLV sequence in LLDPDUs

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.ChassisID
member.summary: A Chassis Identifier
member.description: A mandatory TLV that identifies the chassis containing the IEEE 802 LAN station associated with the transmitting LLDP agent

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.PortID
member.summary: A Port Identifier
member.description: A mandatory TLV that identifies the port component of the MSAP identifier associated with the transmitting LLDP agent.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.TimeToLive
member.summary: Specifies the Time to Live
member.description:
Indicates the number of seconds that the recipient LLDP agent is to regard the information associated with this MSAP identifier to be valid
A value of 0 signals that this source is no longer available and all information associated with it should be deleted.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.PortDescription
member.summary: A Description of the Port
member.description: The port description field shall contain an alpha-numeric string that indicates the ports description.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.SystemName
member.summary: The System's Assigned Name
member.description: The System Name TLV allows network management to advertise the systems assigned name.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.SystemDescription
member.summary: A Description of the System
member.description: The System Description TLV allows network management to advertise the systems description

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.SystemCapabilities
member.summary: A bitmap containing the System's capabilities
member.description: The System Capabilities TLV is an optional TLV that identifies the primary function(s) of the system and whether or not these primary functions are enabled.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.ManagementAddress
member.summary: The Management Address
member.description: The Management Address TLV identifies an address associated with the local LLDP agent that may be used to reach higher layer entities to assist discovery by network management.

member.name: F:PacketDotNet.LLDP.TLVTypes.OrganizationSpecific
member.summary: A vendor-specifid TLV
member.description: This TLV category is provided to allow different organizations, such as IEEE 802.1, IEEE 802.3, IETF, as well as individual software and equipment vendors, to define TLVs that advertise information to remote entities attached to the same media.

member.name: T:PacketDotNet.Utils.Crc32

member.remarks: This class is not intended to be used for security purposes. For security applications use MD5, SHA1, SHA256, SHA384, or SHA512 in the System.Security.Cryptography namespace.
